projectMetaData.name: QTrip
projectMetaData.discription: This project is a part of Crio Fellowship Program in Software Development aimed towards enabling the graduatee to become a skilled & certified full stack engineer.
projectMetaData.secondDiscription: Qtrip is 2nd out of 3 capstone projects assigned from 'Crio' in order to receive certification in 'Fellowship Program in Software Development'.
projectMetaData.projectInfo: As a learner in Crio, I used JavaScript to convert HTML & CSS pages into dynamic pages. And thus enabling to have numerous filters to sort trip destinations.
projectMetaData.secondProjectInfo: QTrip is a travel website aimed at travellers looking for a multitude of adventures in different cities.

Overview.subHeading: QTrip is a travel website aimed at travellers looking for a multitude of adventures in different cities.
Overview.list: During the course of this project, I have
listItems: Created web pages using HTML and CSS and made them dynamic using JavaScript
Improved UX with multi-select filters, image carousels
Implemented conditional rendering of page elements
Utilized localStorage to persist user preferences at client-side and facilitated reservation form submission using fetch API
Deployed the website using Netlify for Frontend and Render for Backend

features.heading: Dynamically render landing page
scope of work items: Retrieved cities data from the backend REST API endpoint using Javascript’s Fetch API
Created HTML for the cities grid with Bootstrap class to add responsiveness
Implemented logic to dynamically plug in city data to the Landing page’s DOM
features.skills: HTML, CSS, JS, Bootstrap, REST APIs, JSON, DOM Manipulation, cURL

features.heading: Adventures page with multi-select filters
scope of work items: Fetched adventures data for the city by invoking the backend API from the page URL’s query parameter
Inserted HTML populated with API response data to the adventure page’s DOM
Implemented logic to add both multi-select and single-select filters
Added logic to persist the filters selected by the user in the browser’s localStorage
features.skills: JS, Bootstrap Flex, Bootstrap Spacing, ES6, localStorage

features.heading: Adventure details page
scope of work items: Adventure details page with reservation support
Added a sleek image carousel using Bootstrap
Implemented reservation logic by using Fetch API to send a POST request to the backend, on form submission
Conditionally rendered the “Sold out” panel based on the API response
features.skills: JS, Bootstrap, Conditional rendering, Bootstrap Carousel

img.imgDisc: Image carousel on the Adventures page

features.heading: Show All reservations
scope of work items: Reservations page to show all the reservations
Conditionally rendered the reservations page based on the API response

features.heading: Deployment
scope of work items: Deployed the QTrip backend to Render
Configured the QTrip dynamic frontend to use the Heroku deployed backend
Deployed the QTrip dynamic frontend to Netlify

projectMetaData.name: QKart
projectMetaData.discription: This project is a part of Crio Fellowship Program in Software Development aimed towards enabling the graduatee to become a skilled & certified full stack engineer.
projectMetaData.secondDiscription: Qkart is 1st out of 3 capstone projects assigned from 'Crio' in order to receive certification in 'Fellowship Program in Software Development'.
projectMetaData.projectInfo: As a learner in Crio, I implemented React reusable components for registration, authentication, cart & checkout and conditional rendering of cart items.
projectMetaData.secondProjectInfo: This is an E-commerce application designed and develop to cater the need of customer by offering a variety of products where all the products data is fetched dynamically via REST APIs from backend

Overview.subHeading: QKart is an E-commerce application offering a variety of products for customers to choose from.
Overview.list: During the course of this project, I have
listItems: Implemented the core logic for registration, login-authentication, products page, shopping cart and checkout
Improved UI by adding responsive design elements for uniform experience across different devices
Utilized REST APIs to dynamically load and render data served by the backend server
Deployed the website using Netlify for Frontend and Render for Backend

features.heading: Registration & Login feature
scope of work items: Implemented logic and used backend API to get the registration & login feature ready
Added validation for the register form user input values to display informative error messages
features.skills: React.js, Event Handling, Forms, React Hooks, REST API, Error Handling

img.imgDisc: Login Page with error message (for wrong credentials)

features.heading: Registration-Login flow & routing
scope of work items: Used React Router library to set up routes in the application and redirect customers to appropriate pages
Added UI and logic to get the Login page ready
Stored user information at client side using localStorage to avoid login on revisit
features.skills: React Router, Material UI, localStorage, Controlled Components, Conditional Rendering

img.imgDisc: Request-response cycle for QKart User signup and login
User flow on website for signup and login

features.heading: Shopping cart and Checkout flow
scope of work items: Added Cart to Products page and made it responsive
Made authenticated POST API calls to implement Cart logic
Rendered Cart with differing designs in Products page and Checkout page using conditional rendering
Implemented UI and logic to add and select new addresses
features.skills: Responsive Design, Reusable Components, HTTP Request, Conditional Rendering

img.imgDisc: Products page UI with responsive Cart design (Left: Desktop, Right: Mobile)

features.heading: Search feature with products display
scope of work items: Utilized the useEffect() hook to fetch products data after DOM is rendered for faster page loading
Added search bar to display only on the Products page’s header and implemented search logic
Implemented debouncing for improved UX and reduced API calls on search
features.skills: Keyword Search, Debouncing, React Hooks, Material UI Grid

img.imgDisc: QKart Products page with search functionality resulting in leather products for searching 'leather'

features.heading: Deployment
scope of work items: Deployed the QKart React app to Netlify
Configured Netlify to support visiting any sub pages directly as React is a single page application

projectMetaData.name: 4U Academy
projectMetaData.discription: 4U Academy runs industry led programs to enhance the learner's job ready skills, through various modes including online teaching, offline classes & mock interviews to nurture the learner's capability of understanding the principles and logics of web development & acing in  their careers.
projectMetaData.projectInfo: I led the development of a comprehensive web platform for an ed-tech startup, utilizing React, Tailwind CSS & Bootstrap to craft a responsive and user-friendly interface. Leveraging my skills, I meticulously built the entire website from the ground up, ensuring seamless navigation and engaging user experiences. To optimize deployment and accessibility, I successfully deployed the project through Netlify, providing a reliable and efficient hosting solution.

Overview.subHeading: 4U Academy is an industry led program to enhance the learner's job ready skills, through various modes including online teaching, offline classes, mock interviews to nurture the learner's capability of understanding the principles and logics of web development & acing in  their careers.
Overview.list: During the course of this project, I have
listItems: Implemented responsive design system for landing, about, courses, placements pages. Also implemented carousel for student reviews
Created these pages using React & styled them with help of Tailwind CSS & React Bootstrap
Utilized locally stored data in JSON format to dynamically load and render course cards & placement card detials

img.imgDisc: Course Cards section on landing page

features.heading: Reviews Carousel
scope of work items: Implemented a carousel for student reviews using react-reponsive-carousel dependency
Added data from locally maintained JSON file

features.heading: Placement Page
scope of work items: Used functional based component & made placement card component
Placement card componenet is rendered after parsing through json data array by passing props to child component

features.heading: Responsive Design
scope of work items: Improved user experience by making whole website responsive & accessible across defferent devices
Used media queries in plain CSS & breakpoint prefix provided by Tailwind CSS to achieve the responsive design results

features.heading: Deployment
scope of work items: Deployed the 4U Academy React app to Netlify
Configured Netlify to support visiting any sub pages directly as React is a single page application
Uploaded on netlify from git repo directly
